docs.title: About zBITX
docs.text:
zBITX is an open-source, modular software and hardware platform based on the BITX series of radios. It is designed for amateur radio operators and developers who want to build, modify, and experiment with modern digital and analog radio systems.

This wiki provides documentation for setup, configuration, modifications, and contributions to the zBITX project. Whether you?re building your first radio or extending the software, we welcome your participation!

  • Website: https://n5qc.github.io/zbitx-wiki
  • GitHub Repository: https://github.com/n5qc/zbitx-wiki

docs.title: Contributing to zBITX Wiki
docs.text: We welcome contributions of all types?corrections, documentation, features, or questions.

docs.title: How to Contribute
docs.text:
1. Fork the repository: n5qc/zbitx-wiki
  2. Create a new branch: git checkout -b my-contribution
  3. Make changes and commit: git commit -m "Describe your change"
  4. Push and open a Pull Request

docs.title: Contribution Guidelines
docs.text:
• Keep language clear and beginner-friendly
  • Break large pages into subtopics when possible
  • Include screenshots, diagrams, or photos if helpful

docs.title: Questions?
docs.text: Open a GitHub Issue or email n5qc@arrl.net.

docs.title: Q: What is zBITX?
docs.text: A: zBITX is a modular, open-source platform based on the BITX series transceivers. It includes software and hardware components for amateur radio experimentation.

docs.title: Q: Where is the source code?
docs.text: A: The main source for documentation is this GitHub repository.

docs.title: Q: How do I flash firmware or update the software?
docs.text: A: See the Software page for setup, configuration, and updating instructions.

docs.title: Q: How can I contribute?
docs.text: A: See the Contributing guide for steps on submitting documentation or code changes.

docs.title: Software Overview
docs.text: This page includes setup instructions, firmware references, and customization tips.

docs.title: Basic Setup
docs.text:
• Install Arduino IDE or PlatformIO
  • Clone the zBITX firmware repository
  • Flash via USB or serial

docs.title: Customization Options
docs.text:
• Configure startup frequency
  • Customize display behavior
  • Enable/disable features like CW keyer or CAT control

docs.title: Troubleshooting
docs.text: If the device fails to boot after flashing, hold the reset button and retry upload.
